Based on your preference cues, I would recommend War Horse and Valkyrie.
War Horse is a captivating historical drama based on Michael Morpurgo's novel of the same name. The film stars David Thewlis as the brave and heroic Captain John Horseshoe, along with Tom Hollander as Private Ludek Szczepanik, Thomas Kretschmann as Lieutenant Commander von Stroheim, Christian Berkel as Captain's Assistant, Gerard McSorley as Sergeant Major of the Horse Battery, Philippe Nahon as Captain's Second in Command, Tom Cruise as American General Dwight D. Eisenhower, Benedict Cumberbatch as Russian General Boris Ivanov, Emily Watson as British General Charles de Gaulle, and Eddie Marsan as American President Franklin D. Roosevelt.
Valkyrie is an epic historical drama based on Michael Morpurgo's novel of the same name. The film stars Timothy Pigott- Smith as the brave and heroic English Field Marshal John Vere "Lance" Croker, along with Joseph Cotten as Captain "D" Croker, Richard Anderson as Private First Class "P" Croker, and Martin Balsam as Assistant Director. The film was directed by Peter Medak.
Bloody Sunday is a historical drama based on the real-life events of February 26, 1972. The film stars Tim Pigott- Smith as Ray MacManes, Joseph Cotten as John Carver, Richard Anderson as Jim Callan, Martin Balsam as Assistant Director, and Eddie Marsan as Tom Callan.
Tora! Tora! Tora! is a historical drama based on the real-life events of December 7, 1941. The film stars James Whitmore as Japanese-American General Dwight D. Eisenhower, along with Richard Anderson as Japanese-American Private First Class Leonard "Lenny" Sands, and Thomas Kretschmann as German-Japanese Commander Admiral Hideki Tateyama.
